New Records: Sanju Samson scored 29 runs off 19 balls with 6 fours and no sixes.
Suryakumar Yadav scored 29 runs off 14 balls with 2 fours and 3 sixes.
Hardik Pandya scored 39 not out off 5 balls with 5 fours and 2 sixes.
Varun Chakaravarthy made his comeback to the Indian team and took 3 wickets.
Key Match Events: India won the match by seven wickets in 11.5 overs.
Hardik Pandya hit a no-look ramp shot over midwicket for a huge six.
Debutant Nitish Kumar Reddy finished unbeaten on 16 runs.
Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh lost early in the first over with Litton Das skying Arshdeep Singh.
Arshdeep Singh took three wickets in the first two overs.
Varun Chakaravarthy entered the attack in the fifth over and took three wickets.
Post-Match Reflections: The match was a memorable night for Varun Chakaravarthy on his comeback.
Hardik Pandya received the loudest cheers for his performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was the first international at the Shrimant Madhavrao Scindia Cricket Stadium in Gwalior.
Mayank Yadav made his international debut and bowled four overs without breaching 150 kmph.
